title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect regarding custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrectly states that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting.
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, when testing with the provided cookiename.war, the actual behavior is different. The page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', but the 'Reload' link on the page uses the default 'jsessionid' instead of the custom cookie name.
EB: Expected behavior: If a custom name is configured for session tracking cookies, it should also be used as the name of the URI parameter if URL rewriting is enabled.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Deploy the attached cookiename.war file. 2. Access http://localhost:8080/cookiename/.
